message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to show you this amazing product that I think you'll love. I'm open to negotiations, but I have to start with a fair price. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $15000. What do you think?
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Would you be willing to meet me at this price?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, I've got to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I can do $14000, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $13000?
I'm willing to work with you, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $13500. I think it's a fair price considering the product's value. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to work with me, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $13250?
I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can do $13750, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. It's a fair price, and I think you'll be happy with it. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $13500?

I'm getting a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. I can do $14000, but that's my absolute final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'm going to have to consider other options.
I understand you're trying to get a fair price, but I'm still trying to stick to my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $13200?
